Speaker: barbara
Dialogue: Alex...

Speaker: ken
Dialogue: My suitcase workin' out for ya?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Whoa! Whoa! Mom, you gotta leave that on. It's like... the tag made the last flight without crashin' or anything, right? So, it should stay on, or with, the bag for good luck.

Speaker: barbara
Dialogue: Where would you get a nutball idea like that?

Speaker: ken
Dialogue: I'm still here.

Speaker: tod
Dialogue: Yeah, we're all set Dad.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: I will. Don't worry.

Speaker: tod
Dialogue: I didn't think anything could worse than my yearbook picture.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Now you know how I feel havin' to look at you all the time.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: What the fuck's he want?

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: The airport doesn't endorse solicitors.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Fuh-ck, do we have to put up with that shit the whole time?

Speaker: hare krishana
Dialogue: Death is not the end.

Speaker: hare krishana
Dialogue: Hare Rama.

Speaker: ticket clerk
Dialogue: I have a few questions to ask you this afternoon.

Speaker: ticket clerk
Dialogue: Have you recieved any packages from persons unknown to you?

Speaker: ticket clerk
Dialogue: Same as your birthday.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I can't believe they let that dickhead on this trip.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: His parents bought a ton of those trip certificates we had to sell, just to get him out of their hair for ten days.

Speaker: tod
Dialogue: Dude, I so worked the ticket clerk so you're sittin' next to Christa and I'm next to Blake.

Speaker: tod
Dialogue: Dude, if we don't get someone going on this flight, we should just call Dr. Kervorkian and put ourselves out of our fuckn' misery.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Man, that is one George Michael notch from being gay.

Speaker: tod
Dialogue: Dude, get wisdom. We're about to board a seven hour flight. The toilets in coach are barely ventilated closets. What if your body wants that airplane food out of your system and you have to go torgue a wicked cable and then right after you walks in Christa or Blake? You want them to associate with you with that reflexive gag and the watery sting in their eyes?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: John Denver...

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: He died in a plane crash.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Good sign. Younger the better. It would be a fucked-up God to take down this plane.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: A REALLY fucked-up God.

Speaker: christa
Dialogue: Could you trade seats with Blake so she and I can sit together? I asked Tod, but he says he's got some medical thing?

Speaker: tod
Dialogue: Fag.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: C'mon, man, like you really thought you were gonna tittie fuck 'em over Greenland, or something?

Speaker: tod
Dialogue: Because of you, I gotta sit here and watch fuckin' "Stepmom."

Speaker: christa
Dialogue: Could you trade seats with Blake so she and I can sit together? I asked Tod, but he's got some medical thing.

Speaker: tod
Dialogue: Dude, what up?

Speaker: flight attendant
Dialogue: Is there a a problem, sir?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: What's your fuckin' problem?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Qu'est-ce se?! THE PLANE'S GONNA EXPLODE!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: We have to get out!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Sit! DOWN! Browning!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: I'm not joking! I'm not joking!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Listen to me! This plane will explode on take-off!

Speaker: flight attendant
Dialogue: Sir, we will remove you from the aircraft if this continues.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I'll remove him.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Fuck you! I'll remove myself!

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: He didn't do nothin'!

Speaker: flight attendant
Dialogue: Anybody in the aisle is off the plane!

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: No, wait, I was late... that's my seat right there!

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I didn't do anything! I have my ticket right here!

Speaker: tod
Dialogue: It's alright. It's alright. You're off the plane. You're off the plane...

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I was in the bathroom. The lock was stuck. I didn't fight with anyone!

Speaker: tod
Dialogue: I called your mom and dad and they're on their way.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: I... I saw it... like, I don't know... the plane took off. I saw it leave the runway... I looked down and saw the ground...

Speaker: tod
Dialogue: Been on many planes that blew up, have you?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: We get thrown off the plane and blow a half day in Paris because Browning has a bad dream?  It's going to explode! It's going to explode!

Speaker: tod
Dialogue: Fuck off, Horton.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Only trip you're gonna take is to the fuckin' hospital.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: There they go and here we stay.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: You're payin' for my trip, Browning!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: I wish you were on the plane!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: You're lookin' at me as if I caused it. I did not cause this.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: How would I know? You think I'm some sort of...

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: He's not a witch.

Speaker: seigel
Dialogue: Hello. I'm Howard Seigel, National Transportation Safety Board vice chairmen. We've notified your families and they are on their way. Does anyone feel they need medical attention or spiritual counseling at this time?

Speaker: seigel
Dialogue: The cause of the explosion is undetermined. Nassau county authorities are on the scene. Naval search and rescue are en route.

Speaker: weine
Dialogue: We understand how you must be feeling at this hour... and although we know it may be difficult, we must ask you some questions... regarding today's events, while it's still fresh in your minds.

Speaker: weine
Dialogue: It may be valuable to our rescue attempts, or any potential... criminal investigation.

Speaker: schreck
Dialogue: You said...  How did you know that?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: I got this... feeling... a weird feeling... I can't explain it...

Speaker: weine
Dialogue: Did you take any seditives before boarding, or on the plane. Sleeping pills?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: No. I saw it. I saw it!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Not like a dream... more than that. I experienced the plane exploding... it was so horrible... I know what they all went through tonight...

Speaker: schreck
Dialogue: Did this "weird feeling" have anything to do with you saying you wished Carter Horton was on the plane... just before it exploded?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: schreck
Dialogue: Why'd you say it?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Because... I... never thought it would really happen.

Speaker: weine
Dialogue: If that's the case, Alex... why did you really get off the plane?

Speaker: tod
Dialogue: My brother... told me to keep an eye on Alex. He stayed... and I went to make sure Alex was okay.  He told me to get off the plane.

Speaker: weine
Dialogue: No one forced you to get off the plane. You told us you aren't friends with any that did... so, why did you leave the airplane?

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Because I saw and I heard Alex. And... I believed him.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Here's good.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Thank you for the ride.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Hope you don't think, Browning, that because my name ain't on this wall... that I owe you anything.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: I don't.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: To live my life to the fullest.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Then maybe you should lay off the J.D.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Don't ever fucking again tell me what to do. I control me. Not you.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I'm never gonna die.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I took my driver's test this week at the DMV...

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Got a 70. Lowest score, but I passed. When I was done with the test, the guy who drives with you during the test, he goes, "Young man, you're going to die at a very young age."  That true?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Not here, not now.  Not EVER!

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: If I ask out Cynthia Paster, will she say "no?"

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Ms. Lewton...

Speaker: tod
Dialogue: Hey.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: I don't want to sound gay, or nothin, but... I miss you.

Speaker: tod
Dialogue: Me, too.  But my dad doesn't understand. When he's better; you and me, road trip to the City. Catch the Yanks.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: That's a plan.

Speaker: tod
Dialogue: I gotta go. This thing Ms. Lewton showed me in her class, they're gonna let me read it. It says what I'm feeling.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Because of you... I'm still alive. Thank you.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: What happened? Is Tod alright?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: What... what happened?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Mr. Waggner...

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: He wouldn't do it!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: He... he told me we would be friends again after you got better. After you got over George. Why would he make plans for the future if he were planning on killing himself?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: It's only the end of June.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Almost like bein' able... to see the future.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Know what this is?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Like, um... you're mad about something?

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: A piece of debris... from the plane. I went to the shore off the crash site and it washed up on the beach.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: You went there? I've wanted to go there, but I thought it was off limits.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: It is. But that didn't stop me. Shouldn't stop you.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Why were you there last night?

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Look, I've seen enough T.V. to know the F.B.I. doesn't investigate teen suicides. But they were there last night, that means: one, they still don't have a clue what caused the crash. Two, they haven't ruled out anything. And the fact that seven people got off the plane is probably weird enough, not to mention, that one of those people had a vision, or whatever, of it exploding minutes before it did explode, is highly suspicious. And it doesn't help that the visionaries' friend just committed suicide.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Why were you there last night?

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Know what this is?

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: It's you.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Not a likeness. It's how you make me feel, Alex.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: I'm... really sorry.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Like you, the sculpture doesn't even know what, or why, it is. Reluctant to take form. And, yet, creating an absolute but incomprehansible attraction.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: And you can still feel it, can't you? Something from that day is still with you. I know, because I can still feel you.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: That's why I was there last night.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: I've never dealt with death before. I wasn't alive when my grandparents died. I wish I could know. I mean, all this... could just be in our heads. Now it feels like it's everywhere.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: "It?"

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: What if Tod... is just the first... of us?  The idea sends a shot of apprehension through Clear.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Is that something you're "feeling?"

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: I don't know. I wish I could just see him... one more time, then, maybe... I would know.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Then, let's go see him!

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Gives me a rush...

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: This place?!

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Doin' somethin' I'm not supposed to.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Good call. Very "Quincy."

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: That... him?

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: I think. But why'd they make him up like... Michael Jackson?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: That's him, but... he's not here. That... whatever... that whatever made him Tod is gone.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Why..?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: I'm... a friend of his. His best friend. See, his father...

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: They said he hung himself, but there's no marks.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: What are all those tiny marks?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Why would he pull at the wire if he were committing suicide?

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Why would they say it was a suicide... if it weren't?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: His father's pretty fucked up with denial. Maybe he couldn't deal with the thought of an other accident... taking another son.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: You saying Tod did kill himself?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Design?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Maybe there's no way to win... but... if you figured out the game... you knew where the "steel ball was rolling" couldn't you avoid the trap and extend the playing time? Couldn't you... cheat Death at Its own game?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: I'm sorry we broke in.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: We didn't find what we were looking for.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Yeah, we did.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: He said Death has a design. Even before he said that I had been seeing patterns.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: As in flannels and plaids?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: How many died on Flight 180? From our group?

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Thirty-nine.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Remember the gate number?

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Thirty-nine.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Remember the departure time?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Right. April 25th.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Wait. I thought you meant the time of your birth. Four/Twenty-five, as in, month and day... that's a reach.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: My birthday is the same as of the time I was meant to die! That's a reach!?

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: You're sounding like those people who, you know... "Oswald shot Kennedy from a warehouse and hid in a theatre and Booth shot Lincoln in a theatre and hid in a warehouse."

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: I'm not just layin' down a bunch of math here, with this. I'm talking about indications... omens... that day, that we were meant to die. That, if, we have been aware of... would have saved everyone on the plane.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: That's total bullshit. You can find death omens anywhere you want to.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: She's leaving the school. Moving away.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Clear, how do we know that by just sitting here, breathing this air or sipping the coffee, having crossed the street... we haven't started in motion the events that will lead to our death? Fifty years from now. Ten years. Tomorrow.  You don't unless... you're able to open yourself to the signs I'm willing to show you.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: I don't understand... did you see Tod die? Did it happen again, like         on the plane?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: No, but it might as well be the same thing. This was a message... from someone, or something... hinting... at the design.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Alex, on the plane... you must have experienced... some kind of hyper awareness. But here... you're suggesting Tod's death... and maybe our own... will happen because of... an active Presence.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: The mortician said Death has a design. Now... if you, me, Tod, Carter, Terry, Billy, Ms. Lewton messed up that design, because, for whatever reason, I was able to see Death's plan... then we cheated it.  But what if it was our time, what if we were not meant to get off that plane? What if it is still is our time? If... It... is still not finished with us? We will all still die; now, not later.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: After hearing you, just now... I do believe...

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Then there's no one left who can help me.

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Baby, come on... not now.

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Carter...

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Kind of have a reunion, here.

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Let it go!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: When are you moving?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: We're losing our favorite teacher.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Look, there's something you should all know.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Alex...

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: Shut up! The both of you!

Speaker: ken
Dialogue: It's that girl... Clear.

Speaker: ken
Dialogue: He's in the shower, Clear. Can I have him get back at ya? Sure... bye.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Dad... you and mom have helped me out, so much. But there's... some things I need to understand before I can talk... to anyone about it.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: The path of the explosion...  That's Death's design.

Speaker: schreck
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Checking the air in her tires to make sure they're safe.

Speaker: schreck
Dialogue: Get in the car.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: I believe that... Ms. Lewton's next.

Speaker: weine
Dialogue: "Next?"

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Yes... see, there's this... pattern... that's occuring.

Speaker: weine
Dialogue: Oh, you've noticed it, too?

Speaker: schreck
Dialogue: Where'd you get this "pattern" from? You have another "vision?" Maybe saw it in some T.V. static?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: I didn't ask for what happened to me on the plane. You can make fun of me. You can think I'm a nut. I'm used to it. I saved six lives but the entire school acts like I'm a freak. Fine.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: I'm not suffering from Post Traumatic Stress. I haven't developed a narcissistic deity complex. I'm not going Dahmer.  This just is. There's a pattern in place for you. And you. There's a design for everyone.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: And I'm not sure yet how... but I intend to break this one.

Speaker: weine
Dialogue: Alex, you got our attention, at first, because you were under suspicion in the plane explosion.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: No... I can't. As long as I'm in here, it's outta my control.

Speaker: weine
Dialogue: Alright, go on. Get outta here.

Speaker: schreck
Dialogue: Kid gives me the creeps.

Speaker: weine
Dialogue: We got nothing to hold him.

Speaker: schreck
Dialogue: I don't mean that...  There's a couple of times, there... I almost believed him.

Speaker: weine
Dialogue: Sometimes, you give me the creeps.

Speaker: john denver
Dialogue: I've seen it rainin' fire from the sky...

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Ms. Lewton!

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Hey, Alex...

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: I don't know where he is. He's not talking to me.

Speaker: weine
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Because I didn't believe him.

Speaker: schreck
Dialogue: If he should contact you, it would be in the best interest of your own safety to contact us.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Terry's name should be on this wall.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: They're watching me, see if I go to Alex.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Are you?

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: They'll follow my car.  That's why you're taking me.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Why would I want to see him?

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Because he knows which one of us is next.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Um... okay... drive the speed limit, right?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Billy! I'm gettin' a vision! You're the next one...

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Hey, man, why'd you say that?!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: 'Cause if you say another word, I'm gonna fuckn' kill ya!

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: He could be anywhere from here to a mile down the shore. You guys drive down there, start this way and we'll meet around the middle. It'll take half the time.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Most kids do, I guess.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Most kids never have it happen.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: When I was ten... my dad went into a 7-11 for cigerettes. I guess he heard somebody say "Don't turn around." So on reflex, or thinkin' a friend was jokin'... he did. And the guy blew his head off.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: And that is the only way we can beat Death... by making something special out of Life.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: This won't be safe.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Those guys are probably fifteen minutes away.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: No.. I mean, I don't have anything on me. This won't be safe.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Nothing is... anymore.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: I can't go home. After Lewton's, they'll be after me.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: We're takin' you to a cabin in the woods, it's only a couple miles from my house.  Keep off the highways, they'll be lookin' for us.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Alright, Browning, you fuckin' warlock... did you know about Ms. Lewton, or what?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Why do you think I was hiding?

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Billy told the F.B.I. he saw you runnin' away from her house.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: They blame me for everything. Her, Tod, the plane crash...

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Your shoe prints were in the blood. Your fingerprints on the knives...

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: I already told you...

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Did you know she was going to be next... before she was?

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: When she died... at that moment, I could tell she saw something... horrible.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Out of us... who's next to see it?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Please tell me I'm gonna get to see the Jets win the Super Bowl.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Me, right? That's why you're not saying.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Shoulda felt up Tammy in the pool, that time...

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Whatta you whinin' about? He said I'm next.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: He didn't say nothin'. Just drive.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: You have a responsibility to tell me.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Is knowing going to make it easier? It makes it harder.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: You get off havin' control over me. Let me choose how to deal with it.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: It doesn't matter who's next... we're all on the same list.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Aww, fuck... really?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Then why bother? What's the fuckin' point? Terry and me will be back together on the other side, so why wait any longer?

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Knock it off!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: May as well go out under my own free will, right?

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Not with us in the fuckin' car!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: What's your fuckin' worry? If it's not your time...? I could get nailed runnin' this red light and you all wouldn't get shit! Only me, right?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: And I fuckin' HATED FRENCH CLASS!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: That's what I'm doin'!

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: I know what you're doing! It's alright to be scared, Carter. You don't have to prove to us how big your balls are. Not now.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I'm not afraid! I DECIDE WHEN IT'S TIME! I control my life! I control my death!

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Watch it! Watch it!

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I am... so close to puking, you don't wanna know.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: We're afraid, too, Carter, but we're not going to quit. Maybe you are. You act like you're not, but you are!

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: So, stop what you're doing and STOP THIS CAR! Right fucking now!

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Move it!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Billy, get out!

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Carter, get out!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: It ain't my time.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I can't get out!

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Man, he really is next.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Scared now?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: It broke!

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: No one's that strong.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Bullshit. He saved your life...again!

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: THAT'S RIGHT! HE'S RIGHT! YOU ARE NEXT! I'M GETTING THE FUCK AWAY FROM YOU!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: SHUT UP, BILLY!

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: WE DON'T NEED THIS NOW!

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I DON'T NEED IT EVER! GET AWAY FROM HIM! HE'S NEXT!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: FUCK YOU, BILLY! I'M NOT DEAD!

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: YOU WILL BE! YOU'RE DEAD! YOU'RE DEAD!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Jesus fucking Christ!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: You should have been next. After Lewton, you should've been next. That's the only pattern. You should be dead.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: You're the fuckin' devil.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: But I saved him. I intervened. Just like the plane. That's the design.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Police are coming.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: That's why It skipped Carter and went to the next one in the path of the explosion; Billy.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: "Intervention?" What are you, God now?!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Of course not! Gods aren't afraid to die! Gods don't die! We do!

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: You're losin' it. The police will be here. We have to go to the cabin. You can hide there. Get your head together.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: After Billy... it's me. And then you.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Then, get out of here.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: I overlooked it. You tried to capitalize. But I caught you, you fuck. I can beat you. Not forever, but I got this cabin rigged to beat you NOW!

Speaker: weine
Dialogue: She was up there a minute ago...

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: I'm not turning him in. There's another life that needs him now.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: I go with you.

Speaker: weine
Dialogue: You can't.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Don't hurt him.

Speaker: weine
Dialogue: Tell us where he is. Wait at home, and I promise... we'll bring him back safe, in protective custody.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: I... never moved. Christa asked me to move, but I didn't change seats. I would've moved up... next to Tod... How could I not remember... that... I never moved. Clear's seat was in front of mine...

Speaker: schreck
Dialogue: There!

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: Run!

Speaker: cut to:
Dialogue: EXT. FOREST - NIGHT - CLOSE - ALEX'S EYES

Speaker: weine
Dialogue: Lost him.

Speaker: schreck
Dialogue: From the direction... there's only one place he can heading...

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: Don't move!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: You're grounded in the car. Don't touch anything. DON'T MOVE.

Speaker: weine
Dialogue: Alex, get away from there!

Speaker: schreck
Dialogue: Any part of that line touches you, you're dead.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: NO!

Speaker: weine
Dialogue: Get back! You'll both die!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: You know what to do.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: No! No! Don't!

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: When I do this.. it'll have skipped you... and it'll all be over.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: You know what to do. I'll always be with you.

Speaker: alex
Dialogue: NO!

Speaker: schreck
Dialogue: Is he alive?

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: A little more. Little more!

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: He's here. A beautiful boy.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: I felt him! When the baby was born... I felt Alex pass through me... like the night he died...

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: 13th of May... 4:25 p.m.

Speaker: barbara
Dialogue: Exactly a year... to the minute.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: We beat it, Alex.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Alex was right.

Speaker: clear
Dialogue: I believe... that's what Alex believed. But how do we know... this wasn't the design all along?
